properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 11:34AM EST until January 25 at 7:19PM EST by NWS Mount Holly NJ
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a flood warning for
the following rivers in Pennsylvania...

East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown affecting Chester County

The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The East Branch Brandywine Creek at Downingtown.
* until this evening...Or until the warning is cancelled.
* At 11:01 AM Saturday the stage was 6.2 feet.
* Flood stage is 7.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by late this morning and continue to rise to
near 7.2 feet by this afternoon.the river will fall below flood stage by this
afternoon.
* Impact...At 8.0 feet...Dowlin Forge Road begins to flood.
* Flood history...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.0 feet on Aug 4
2018.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...Do not attempt to drive through flooded areas. The water may be
deeper than you think.
